description:
## Hands-on
### Task
Given the CSV with locations in the provider. Generate triples with the data properties ***foaf:name***, ***geo:lat*** and ***geo:long*** in order to achieve the expected results.
### CSV file content
| CName | latitude | longitude |
|--|--|--|--|
| Oneonta | "44.9625428" | "-74.4168577" |
| Iowa | "29.6862705" | "-82.319746" |
| Alberta | "41.0816094" | "-76.4098259" |
| Bock | "41.6908535" | "-85.9562663" | 
| Elmhurst | "31.4199205" | "-109.9103821" |
solution_template:
<#assign locations=providers("HttpProvider", {"url" : "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/helio-ecosystem/helio-ecosystem/main/resources/mappings-data/ldac/locations.csv", "method" : "GET"})>
<#-- WRITE BELOW -->
<#assign rows = locations?split("\n")>
  <#list locations?split("\n") as location>
	<#if !location?is_first>
		<#assign cols=location?split(",")>
		<#if cols?size == 3>
<http://sample.com/resource/[=cols[0]]> foaf:name "[=cols[0]]";
	geo:lat [=cols[1]?trim] ;
	geo:long [=cols[2]?trim] .
		</#if>
	</#if>
</#list>
expected_result:
<http://sample.com/resource/Oneonta> foaf:name "Oneonta";
    geo:lat "44.9625428" ;
    geo:long "-74.4168577" .
<http://sample.com/resource/Iowa> foaf:name "Iowa";
    geo:lat "29.6862705" ;
    geo:long "-82.319746" .
<http://sample.com/resource/Alberta> foaf:name "Alberta";
    geo:lat "41.0816094" ;
    geo:long "-76.4098259" .
<http://sample.com/resource/Bock> foaf:name "Bock";
    geo:lat "41.6908535" ;
    geo:long "-85.9562663" .
<http://sample.com/resource/Elmhurst> foaf:name "Elmhurst";
    geo:lat "31.4199205" ;
    geo:long "-109.9103821" .
